timeline.message: fix(subsystem): fix manifest's classpath gatherning in buildscript time. (locked cache)
chore(subsystem): replace copyrigh with 2 line copyright
feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): move tests from engine to TypEHandlerLibrary subsystem
feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): add tests for simple type handlers and byte/bytes type handlers
feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): move most part of code from TypeHandlerLibraryIml
chore(TypeHandlerLibrary): remove public modifiers for tests (sonarlint - junit 5 issue)
feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): split TypeHandlerLibraryTest and setup default handlers correctly
chore(TypeHandlerLibrary): make fields private for TypeHandlerLibrary
perf(TypeHandlerLibrary): replace mock with implementation in CharacterTypeHandlerTest

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to doFirst here?
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText:
trying to collect RuntimeClasspath at setup gradle script is bad practics ( it happens every time when you press gradle's refresh button)
Also i catched race condition over gradle's cache  when extracted TypeHandlerLibrary.
Then I did use doFirst for avoid race condition and made collecting RuntimeClasspath task-related.
doFirst, not doLast - because manifest required at task's running.
{@see https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/tutorial_using_tasks.html}
replies.author: DarkWeird

timeline.author: skaldarnar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+// Copyright 2020 The Terasology Foundation
+// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+
+/**
+ * This package contains the interfaces and abstract classes for use when defining type handlers.
+ * Type handlers provide the algorithms for serializing and deserializing types - this uses an implementation agnostic set of interfaces
+ * so TypeHandlers can be used for different serialization techniques (Json, Protobuf, etc).

timeline.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can add some Javadoc here? I guess this returns the Serializer for the given type, or null if no serializer for that type was registered?
timeline.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText:
Is this change intentional? Is it important that the factory is added to this implementation or would the interface be better in the docstring here?
I'm actually not sure what the best practice here is ... 🤔
timeline.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to support this without a rounding mode? when would that be of use?
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText:
just copied behavior from protobuf and/or gson PersistentData impls.
Really idkm why?
replies.author: DarkWeird

timeline.author: skaldarnar

timeline.bodyText: Testing some edge cases would be nice, but the setup is quite nice and we can easily add them later.
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText:
this typehandlers almost haven't edge cases. (related to java's data types)
yeah, I known one case :D sends emoji character to CharacterTypeHandler.. and deserialize it back.
replies.author: DarkWeird

timeline.message: feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): add Test for In-memory persistent
feat(TypeHandlerLibrary): move `ConstructorLibrary`, `CollectionTypeHandlerFactory`, `OjbectFiledMapTypeHandlerFactory` and they tests  to `TypeHandlerWidget` subsystem.
docs(TypeHandlerLibrary): some license headers and docs
